required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sub-occipital Muscle Inhibition in Tension Type Headache
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Efficacy of Tension Type Headache After Application of Sub-occipital Muscle Inhibition Technique Associated With Interferential Electrotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to determine the effects caused in neck movement, neck pain, headache in patients with tension type headache and cervicogenic headache after application of sub-occipital muscle inhibition technique associated with interferential electrotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is based on the combined application of sub-occipital muscle inhibition technique associated with interferential electrotherapy improves symptoms in patients with tension type headache and cervicogenic headache.
The purposes of this study are:
- Evaluate the effectiveness of treatment based on the combined application of sub-occipital muscle inhibition technique associated with interferential electrotherapy in patients with tension type headache.
- Evaluate the effects of treatment caused in upper cervical movement.
- Evaluate the effects of treatment caused in neck pain.
- Evaluate the effects of treatment caused in headache.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of assessment of upper cervical range of motion
primary_outcome.time_frame: screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
primary_outcome.description: For assessment of upper cervical range of motion

primary_outcome.measure: Change of predictive quality of life
primary_outcome.time_frame: screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
primary_outcome.description: Spanish version of the health questionnaire SF-12 (Short form -12)

primary_outcome.time_frame: screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
primary_outcome.description: Spanish version of Headache Impact Test questionnaire (HIT-6)

primary_outcome.time_frame: screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
primary_outcome.description: Spanish version headache disability index questionnaire

primary_outcome.measure: Change of neck pain and cervical dysfunction
primary_outcome.time_frame: : screening visit, the last visit (4 weeks) and after fifteen days follow-up visit
primary_outcome.description: Spanish version Neck Disability Index questionnaire (NDI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Age, sex, height, weight and body mass index of patients with tension type headache

arm_group.description: At the first month it will be no intervention group but then if it will be.This will be done for all subjects receive treatment
Experimental: Treatment efficacy of tension type headache after application of sub-occipital muscle inhibition technique associated with interferential electrotherapy

intervention.intervention_name: Experimental: Treatment of sub-occipital muscle inhibition
intervention.description: Experimental: Sub-occipital muscle inhibition The intervention will last for 4 weeks with 2 days of treatment at week. Each of the interventions will consist in application of sub-occipital muscle inhibition technique associated with interferential electrotherapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with tension type headache
- In prophylactic regimen and with medical control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with neurological or cognitive impairments that prevent understanding the questionnaires
- Patients diagnosed with other types of headaches
- Patients who have not signed the informed consent document
